greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of divisors d of n such that either d=1 or Stern polynomial B(d,x) is reducible.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..22001
example: For n=25, with divisors [1, 5, 25], both B(5,x) and B(25,x) are irreducible, so only 1 is counted and a(25)=1.
xref: Differs from A033273 for the first time at n=25.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 10 2017
